definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: From the threshing floor? From the winepress?
And the angel of the LORD stood by the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
sentences.chinese: 那時，耶和華的使者站在耶布斯人阿珥楠的禾場那裏。

sentences.english: Withdraw your hand.' The angel of the Lord was then standing at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
sentences.chinese: 那時，耶和華的使者站在耶布斯人阿珥楠的禾場那裏。

sentences.english: Withdraw your hand. " The angel of the LORD was then standing at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
sentences.chinese: 那時，耶和華的使者站在耶布斯人阿珥楠的禾場那裏。

sentences.english: And the floors shall be full of wheat, and the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.
sentences.chinese: 禾場必滿了麥子，酒榨與油榨必有新酒和油盈溢。

sentences.english: Supply him liberally from your flock, your threshing floor and your winepress.
sentences.chinese: 要從你羊羣，禾場，酒榨之中多多地給他。
